intro: Pachyanthus cubensis subsp. blancheanus, commonly known as the Cuban white hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Cuba. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are ovate to lanceolate, with a smooth surface and a prominent midrib. The flowers bloom in summer and are often used in traditional medicine and ornamental horticulture.
